snippet: Major League Baseball suspended Cole Hamels for five games for intentionally hitting the Nationals’ Bryce Harper with a pitch on Sunday.
abstract: Major League Baseball suspends Philadelphia Phillies pitcher Cole Hamels for five games for intentionally hitting Washington Nationals outfielder Bryce Harper with a pitch. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA -- Phillies pitcher Cole Hamels eschewed evasiveness Sunday night when he acknowledged intentionally hitting Bryce Harper, the Washington Nationals' heralded rookie outfielder, with a pitch. Major League Baseball responded to Hamels's actions -- and perhaps his candid remarks, too -- with a five-game suspension and an undisclosed fine Monday. ''He could have been more discreet about it or a little less honest,'' Phillies Manager Charlie Manuel said before the Phillies' game Monday night against the Mets. ''Actually, the way I looked at that, baseball's going to take care of that. The way you take care of that is with the two teams on the field.''

headline.main: Phillies' Hamels Is Suspended For Five Games
